questions.questionText:
A recipe needs 350ml of milk per person. You are cooking for 7 people.

How much milk do you need? Milk comes in 1 litre bottles.

questionData.originalText:
A recipe needs 350ml of milk per person. You are cooking for 7 people.

How much milk do you need? Milk comes in 1 litre bottles.

questions.hint: You need enough milk, so round up

questions.moduleDescription: Use estimation to check answers to calculations and determine, in the context of a problem, an appropriate degree of accuracy
questions.questionText:
You calculated that you need 6.67 buses to transport everyone.

How many buses should you actually book?

questionData.originalText:
You calculated that you need 6.67 buses to transport everyone.

How many buses should you actually book?

questions.hint: You need enough buses for everyone, so round up

questions.questionText:
A scientist records temperature as 23.4¬∞C (not 23.37¬∞C)

Why is this rounding appropriate?

questionData.originalText:
A scientist records temperature as 23.4¬∞C (not 23.37¬∞C)

Why is this rounding appropriate?

questions.correctAnswer: Nearest 0.1¬∞C is appropriate for this type of measurement
multipleChoiceOptions: Nearest 0.1¬∞C is appropriate for this type of measurement
questions.hint: Think about practicality and what makes sense for this situation
